result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Areyona S Lebourgeois

defendant.name: Lebourgeois, Areyona S
defendant.address: 2868 A N 57 Locust St Upper, Milwaukee, WI 53210

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:53 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Areyona S Lebourgeois in court with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes a preliminary hearing waiver has been filed and inquires how the matter will be proceeding today.  Atty. Miller advises she is prepared to waive the preliminary hearing and then proceed to plea and sentencing today.    The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Court will then proceed to plea/sentencing.

State recites the offer.
Atty. Miller confirms the offer.
Court orders this case dismissed and read into 20CF897 pursuant to the offer.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty. Cassandra Miller as counsel of record for the defendant.

ADDRESS INFO for Areyona S Lebourgeois

Prior: 2359 N Hubbard St, Milwaukee, WI 53212

10:00 AM Defendant Areyona S Lebourgeois in court with attorney Cassandra Miller as a friend of the court.   
District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Voge, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for Initial Appearance. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
State is requesting cash bail.
Defense makes statements and requests signature bond.
Court sets signature bond.

Defense will be waiving the preliminary hearing at the next court appearance.
Court tolls the time limits.
Defense requests date for new date for Plea and Sentencing.

Clerk schedules accordingly.  Hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
